content:
I'm trying to create an IG from scratch using FSH. I've already asked a question on #IG creation because I'm not getting any output html files after running sushi and then the publisher.

I have two FSH files with my profiles and they are being generated in build/input/profiles and the ImplementationGuide.json is also generated in build/input. I have an index.md and a menu.xml in ig-data/input/pagecontent and ig-data/input/includes respectively and they are being copied over into the build/input directory.

But I'm not getting any HTML files generated when I run the publisher. Is this a sushi problem, i.e. I am missing something to tell sushi to create something for the publisher? Or is it a publisher problem?
I'm able to generate an IG using sushi from scratch and running igpublisher. Is your igpublisher up-to-date?
i did the _updatePublisher.bat so I'm assuming it's the latest
Can you run the FSH tutorial and generate an IG? https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-shorthand/tutorial.html
yes, that works fine. so it does have to be me
dang space in the directory. Didn't realize a grandparent directory had a space in its name. So Jekyll wasn't actually doing anything.

you probably already saw this, but here's the doc on sushi inputs and outputs
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-shorthand/sushi.html#sushi-inputs

Didn't realize a grandparent directory had a space in its name. So Jekyll wasn't actually doing anything.

So that's an IG Publisher limitation, right? I just want to be sure there is nothing for us to fix on the SUSHI side...
